Learn More & Join Download Assignment PDF Before You Shoot â€¢ Familiarize yourself with your camera's metering mode settings. â€¢ Set your camera to Aperture Priority mode with ISO 200 fixed. â€¢ Choose a location with varying light conditions (e.g., shadows and bright areas). â€¢ Make sure your battery is charged and memory card is empty. â€¢ Have a notebook or digital device to record your settings and observations. The Assignment Technical Focus â€¢ Use Matrix metering for general scenes to start. â€¢ Switch to Centre-weighted metering for portrait photography. â€¢ Implement Spot metering when photographing subjects with high contrast backgrounds. â€¢ Adjust exposure compensation to +1 to +2 EV for bright scenes. â€¢ Use the histogram to check for highlight clipping after taking a shot. Creative Focus â€¢ Experiment with different metering modes to see how they affect the final image. â€¢ Use Centre-weighted metering to create balanced portraits that highlight the subject. â€¢ Incorporate Spot metering to draw attention to specific details in high-contrast scenes. â€¢ Try shooting in a variety of lighting conditions to challenge your metering skills. â€¢ Vary your exposure compensation to explore creative effects in your images. Assignment Tasks â€¢ Using Aperture Priority mode at f/4 with ISO 200 fixed, photograph a bright outdoor scene and use Matrix metering to capture a well-exposed image. â€¢ Switch to Centre-weighted metering and take a portrait shot in natural light, ensuring the subject is correctly exposed while the background is slightly darker. â€¢ Find a scene with harsh lighting contrasts, such as backlit subjects, and use Spot metering to focus on the subject's face, adjusting the exposure as necessary. â€¢ Photograph a snowy landscape using Aperture Priority mode at f/8 with ISO 200 fixed, applying +1 to +2 EV exposure compensation to avoid underexposure. â€¢ Set your camera to Shutter Priority mode at 1/250s with ISO 200 fixed, and use Spot metering to capture a subject in motion against a bright background, ensuring correct exposure. â€¢ Use Aperture Priority mode at f/2.8 with ISO 200 fixed, photograph a scene at dusk using Centre-weighted metering, and then check the histogram for highlight warnings. ðŸ’¡ Stretch Tasks â€¢ Shoot a series of images using all three metering modes in various lighting conditions, comparing the results to see which mode performs best for each situation. â€¢ Create a portfolio of images that showcase the impact of exposure compensation adjustments on your photographs.
